messages: 2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:28): Is there a single CD image I can get to install NetBSD?  The install guide mentions a plethora of different packages.
e207ced26c778df5c50211b353cb110d (05:30): Packages is additional software
e207ced26c778df5c50211b353cb110d (05:30): You can grab an iso and install NetBSD and that's that
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:30): ryno: from ftp.netbsd.org/pub/NetBSD/iso/ ?
e207ced26c778df5c50211b353cb110d (05:30): But if you want third party software you need to get pkgsrc or a cd with packages on it
e207ced26c778df5c50211b353cb110d (05:31): Make sure you grab the iso for your arch though
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:31): ryno: Are the -pkg CD's a superset of the regular ones?
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:31): ryno: Or do I need both?
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (05:31): pkgs are third party software, they are not NetBSD the OS
e207ced26c778df5c50211b353cb110d (05:32): You only need the install iso
e207ced26c778df5c50211b353cb110d (05:32): But if you want additional software grab the pkg cd
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:32): ryno: But the pkg CD won't do the install?
e207ced26c778df5c50211b353cb110d (05:32): Unless you have a connection to the net for that machine
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:33): ryno: Hey, how fast is NetBSD at booting?
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:33): ryno: Relatively speaking.
e207ced26c778df5c50211b353cb110d (05:34): Pretty darn fast sparky
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:34): ryno: cool.
e207ced26c778df5c50211b353cb110d (05:34): I'd say depending on the machine 30-60 secs
ef8fecc6f3f1398a60aa989bfa6a3cc0 (05:36): it beats the crap out of debian and archlinux on my 366 mhz laptop @ booting @ responsiveness  in X
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (05:37): ^T makes booting much faster
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (05:37): or atleast it makes it less boring waiting on fsck
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:39): Does it have journaling filesystems?
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (05:39): ttuttle: see the topic?
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (05:39): ttuttle: all your questions are there
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (05:39): lfs yes
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (05:40): using a small bzip filesystem for keeping backups and a large lfs partition works great for me... much less fsck
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (05:40): easy to restore if lfs dies
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:45): Ober: bzip filesystem?
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:45): Ober: Does LFS die often?
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (05:46): not lately
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (05:46): in 3.0 it is not ready for prod, but -current is getting there
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (05:47): when I say bzip I mean a normal /backup directory where I bzip up the majority of directories like /home /usr etc
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:53): I'm burning my install CD right now.
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (05:54): if you want a current iso
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:54): Too late, just used up my last CD-R :-\
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (05:55): http://zeniv.linux.org.uk/~ober/netbsd-i386.iso.bz2 4af455295d8d0edb95eac78adb892abc Latest -current
ce8a1609cf8d1a408da3cac46365f53e (05:55): it's a couple weeks old
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:56): Mmm, pretty boot messages.
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:58): Eek, how do I select a partition to install to?
ef8fecc6f3f1398a60aa989bfa6a3cc0 (05:58): ttuttle: dude, just follow the handbok
ef8fecc6f3f1398a60aa989bfa6a3cc0 (05:58): *handbook
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (05:59): I don't have any primary partitions left!
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (06:00): I assume I can't install to a secondary one?
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (06:01): Wait, I *do* have a slot free!
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (06:02): Bah, the shell on the install disc is pitiful!  No tab completion!
3f95cc472930da5329b1e5d44cb6613b (06:03): don't insult sh
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (06:03): I'll gladly wait the extra 0.000001 seconds for a bigger install disc.

2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (06:04): Alright, here's my problem.  My disk is filled with 3 partitions.  Two are primary (boot and swap), and the third has 3 extended partitions.  I want to create a 4th primary partition that takes the space of the middle of those three extended partitions.
3f95cc472930da5329b1e5d44cb6613b (06:15): ttuttle: don't create netbsd partitions in extended ones
3f95cc472930da5329b1e5d44cb6613b (06:15): that's my advice of the day
2ae294fcd4d447a63309579ba2b4ad81 (06:21): krp: I don't think I have a choice :-\
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (06:34): this issue is driving me nuts... every now and then (about once a day) one of the machines becomes unreachable
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (06:35): I'd think it's the router, yet other machines aren't affected by the problem. and restarting dhclient on that machine fixes the problem
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (06:36): on the other hand, the machine is still accessible from inside the lan, which makes me believe the problem is at the router level
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (06:39): what OS?
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (06:41): router runs ipf and ipnat
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (06:41): server runs a bunch of stuff like apache, smtp...
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (06:42): why is the server using dhclient?
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (06:42): it has a statically defined dhcp lease
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (06:43): you have a server that depends on another server to get on the network
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (06:43): no particular reason, mostly because it's useful on the admin side
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (06:46): what happens when your dhcpd machine dies?
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (06:46): the network dies too ;p
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (06:47): it's the router/firewall
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (06:49): does this dropping off the WAN coincide with lease renewal time?
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (06:49): it's a good question
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (06:49): you don't know?
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (06:49): I thought it made admin easier...
334980e1e056773993bf52426a66cdc9 (06:50): I did change it to statically defined, I'll what it gives
f1ac60ceaad69b9c4b9a8654560f1e53 (06:51): you what it gives it what?
